intro: Scrophularia varia, commonly known as the variable figwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are tubular and come in shades of pink to purple, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scrophularia varia is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
